{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3283565,"name":"Noah Simon","username":"tubularturtle8","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tubularturtle8/{size}/209634_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-13T21:34:21.187Z","cooked":"

Hey y’all, my team’s been struggling with getting the new path planner 2024 update to work well, specifically with regard to rotation. You can see the problem in this video, where the robot does not follow its setpoint ghost. In trying to debug, I made a copy of the PPHolonomicDriveController to log data, and the angular velocity throughout the middle area of the path, as outputted by the trapezoidProfile, is just 0.

rotation bug in 3D field

rotation bug in swerve tab

This is run in the RobotContainer constructor

image935×414 22.2 KB

This is the Follower Config

image1071×270 21.9 KB

These are the four lambda function parameters

image868×399 18.5 KB

image1082×306 20.8 KB

image1138×474 32.6 KB

This is the path I want it to follow

And, finally, this is the follow path method we have set up

image806×106 7.63 KB

It drives with our teleop delfault command perfectly fine, no issues there, and the setChassisSpeeds method is made to work with robotRelative speeds so I’m not sure where our problem is. Any help would be greatly appreciated

There’s not a problem anywhere, its just how the rotation speed limiting works. The modules can only do so much, so if you are driving at your max speed, there is not any module speed left over to accomplish the rotation. Last year, this would just over saturate the modules and hurt path following accuracy. PPLib 2024 slows down rotation speed in favor of maintaining accuracy.

Make sure that the numbers you have set for the max module speed and drive base radius in your HolonomicPathFollower config are correct. If rotation is not being completed after that, you’ll need to reduce the translation speed of the robot to leave some module speed for the rotation component.

mjansen4857:

Make sure that the numbers you have set for the max module speed and drive base radius in your HolonomicPathFollower config are correct. If rotation is not being completed after that, you’ll need to reduce the translation speed of the robot to leave some module speed for the rotation component.

Thank you so much! Just to test I reduced all the constraint speeds significantly and it solved the problem imediately. I can’t believe I didn’t think to try that out before. Thanks again!

No problem. Looking at the screenshot of your path, it looks like it has a max velocity of 3 which is pretty reasonable unless you have fairly slow modules. What is the max module speed actually set to? When it completely stops rotation like that it should mean the speed of the robot is going equal to or faster than the max module speed.

This is being used in simulation, not our actual robot, as the drive base for our team is not complete. As a result, we don’t have proper measurements of things like robot mass and moi to make the simulation’s values realistic, so we just picked values that we consider good enough. More important to us than whether or not the max speed is 3 or some more optimal number is just making sure the logic all works so that when we go to work for our irl robot, tuning is all that we need to worry about. Thank you so much for your help!
